page.title: 05LOCAL EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Courtaulds was built on Longridge Road in 1939 to manufacture Rayon to be used in tyres. It ran for 7 years without the machinery being halted. At its peak 3,500 people were employed producing 1 million pounds of tyre yarn and 450,000 pounds of garment rayon. Unemployment. When Nylon and Terylene made by ICI came on the market it was cheaper to produce than rayon. This resulted in Courtaulds closing down in 1979 losing 2,500 jobs. The site is now being developed as Red Scar Industrial Estate facilitating 50 firms. It is hoped that work will be provided here and across the road on the Rough Hey Trading Estate for some of the people who are unemployed in the area.
